author: Staff Reporter
text:
An expert team headed by Professor V. Sundar of Department of Ocean Engineering conducted a survey in the coastal villages affected by sea erosion from Neerodi to Arogyapuram in Kanyakumari district on Thursday.

In view of continuous threat from sea erosion, fishermen from coastal villages were demanding construction of groynes along the coastal villages to the government.

On the basis of their appeal, the government formed an expert committee headed by Professor V. Sundar of Ocean Engineering, IIT, Chennai recently.

The team comprising Professor S. A. Sannasiraj conducted survey in the coastal villages. The team finished its survey in Kanyakumari district. It was expected that they would conduct survey in Thoothukudi, Tirunelveli, Ramanathapuram and other adjoining districts in the next few days.

It was expected that the team would submit its report on prevention of sea erosion to the government within a month and based on their report, government would decide the type and design of the groynes, said A. Christhu Nesaraj, Executive Engineer, Public Works Department here on Thursday.

P. Justin Antony, founder-president of International Fishermen Development Trust accompanied the team in Eraviputhanthurai and Chinnathurai.
title: Team conducts survey of sea erosion-hit villages
